chinese: [C] (BrE also generalisation) a statement about all the members of a group that may be true in some or many situations but is not true in every case （片面的）概括，泛论
examples: e.g. You can't make [[generalizations]] about what men and women are like.

chinese: [C, U] an idea or story that many people believe, but which is not true （许多人相信的）错误观念，荒诞说法
examples: e.g. Contrary to the popular [[myth]], women are not worse drivers than men.

chinese: [C] (fml.) a husband or wife 配偶
examples: e.g. Please notice that [[spouses]] are welcome to the company picnic.

chinese: (fml.) (only before noun) connected with a husband or wife; of or from a husband or wife 配偶的
examples: e.g. Here are the 10 things you should never say in a [[spousal]] argument.

chinese: feeling annoyed and impatient because you cannot do or achieve what you want 懊丧的；懊恼的；沮丧的
examples: e.g. Stacy got so [[frustrated]] that she stood up and walked out of the room.

chinese: [U] the state of being logical and true 符合逻辑；正当；正确
examples: e.g. We had serious doubts about the [[validity]] of their argument.

chinese: (~ from) develop as a result of sth. else 源于；来自；由···引起
examples: e.g. He told the magazine in an exclusive interview that all his misfortune [[stemmed]] from a lack of tolerance toward others.

chinese: [C]（植物的）茎，梗，柄
examples: e.g. He told the magazine in an exclusive interview that all his misfortune [[stemmed]] from a lack of tolerance toward others.

chinese: go around searching for food or other supplies （为找到食物、补给等）四处搜寻
examples: e.g. When it's cold and snowy outside, birds may [[forage]] for food in your backyard.

chinese: [C] (pl. millennia /mɪˈleniə/) a period of 1,000 years 一千年；千年期
examples: e.g. The year 2000 was celebrated as the beginning of the third [[millennium]].

chinese: based on instinct, not thought or training 本能的；直觉的；天性的
examples: e.g. Animals provide the best examples of [[instinctive]] behavior.

chinese: [C] (fml.) a particular way or style of behaving, living, or doing sth. 方式；方法；做法
examples: e.g. Many children recognize that cycling and walking are environmentally-friendly [[modes]] of transportation.

chinese: [U] the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth 营养（作用）；滋养
examples: e.g. It is widely known that [[nutrition]] and exercise are essential to fitness and health.

chinese: (of food) containing many of the substances which help the body to grow （食物）有营养的，营养丰富的
examples: e.g. The cookbook contains many simple yet highly [[nutritious]] meals.

chinese: fit or suitable to be eaten; not poisonous 适宜食用的；（无毒而）可以吃的
examples: e.g. There are many [[edible]] fruits growing wild in the coastal forest.

chinese: get rid of sth. 扔掉；弃置
examples: e.g. Would you help me remove the seeds from the melon and [[discard]] them?

chinese: heavily loaded with sth. 载满的；装满的
examples: e.g. He was surprised to find that the tables were [[laden]] with food.

chinese: [U, sing.] the traditional beliefs, values, customs, etc. of a family, country, or society （文化）遗产；传统
examples: e.g. These works of art are of great importance to Russia's national [[heritage]].

chinese: relating to the time in history before anything was written down 史前的；有历史记载以前的
examples: e.g. We do not have to go back to [[prehistoric]] times to witness the change in our diet.

chinese: 1) [C] sth. that you buy or obtain, often to add to things that you already have 购置物；获得物
examples: e.g. The Art Society is holding an exhibition of recent [[acquisitions]].；e.g. We need to recognize that second language [[acquisition]] is a gradual developmental process.

chinese: 2) [U] the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill （知识、技能的）获得，习得
examples: e.g. The Art Society is holding an exhibition of recent [[acquisitions]].；e.g. We need to recognize that second language [[acquisition]] is a gradual developmental process.

chinese: (of the air or climate) warm and damp （空气或气候）温暖潮湿的，湿热的
examples: e.g. It was a hot, [[humid]] day, and the only sound was the buzzing of insects.

chinese: [C] (fml.) a particular quality in sb.'s character （某人性格中的）特性，品质
examples: e.g. It's a human [[trait]] to joke about subjects that make us uncomfortable.

chinese: [C] an inclination toward a particular characteristic or type of behavior 趋势；趋向；倾向
examples: e.g. For students, there is a [[tendency]] to socialize in the evenings.

chinese: [C] a person who studies anthropology 人类学家
examples: e.g. [[Anthropologists]] study the origin, development, and functioning of human societies and cultures.

chinese: [C, U] the state of being almost the same, or a particular way in which sth. is almost the same 相似性；类似性；相似处；相似点
examples: e.g. The police are checking for [[similarities]] with other recent attacks in the area.

chinese: [C] a member of your family who lived a long time ago 祖先；祖宗
examples: e.g. Although I'm British myself, my [[ancestors]] were actually French.

chinese: of, relating to, or inherited from an ancestor 祖先的
examples: e.g. The house is the [[ancestral]] home of Baron Stourton, but after the family moved out in the 1960s it fell into disrepair.

chinese: (be ~ to do sth.; be ~ to sth.) be likely to do sth. or behave in a particular way 有做某事的意向；倾向于做某事
examples: e.g. They'll be more [[inclined]] to listen carefully if you don't shout.

chinese: (only before noun) long or longer than usual or expected 较长时间的；延期的
examples: e.g. If you are going abroad for an [[extended]] period of time, you should consider renting your house out.

chinese: (only before noun) based on experiments or experience rather than ideas or theories 以实验（经验）为依据的；经验主义的
examples: e.g. There is strong [[empirical]] evidence to suggest that these concerns are not trivial.

chinese: [C, U] a good reason why sth. exists or is done 正当理由
examples: e.g. I can see no possible [[justification]] for your being late.

chinese: have qualities, physical features, etc. that are similar to those of your parents, grandparents, etc. 经遗传获得（品质、身体特征等）
examples: e.g. Mr. Grass [[inherited]] his work ethic from his father.；e.g. He [[inherited]] a large sum of money from his grandmother about 10 years ago.

chinese: receive money, property, etc. from sb. when they die 继承（金钱、财产等）
examples: e.g. Mr. Grass [[inherited]] his work ethic from his father.；e.g. He [[inherited]] a large sum of money from his grandmother about 10 years ago.

chinese: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment 明智的；合理的；实际的；有判断力的
examples: e.g. People are far more [[sensible]] about what and how much they drink these days.

chinese: have an effect on or concern a particular person, group, or situation 适用于；对···有效
examples: e.g. The offer only [[applies to]] flights from London and Manchester.

chinese: whatever is needed to achieve sth. 不惜一切代价
examples: e.g. I have to avoid being late for work again [[at all costs]], or I'll lose my job.

chinese: (BrE, spoken) immediately or without delay 立刻；马上
examples: e.g. I wrote him a letter and posted it [[straight away]].

chinese: (also in … terms) used to show what aspects of a subject you are talking about or how you are thinking about it 谈及；就···而言；在···方面；从···方面来说
examples: e.g. It's a mistake to think of Florida only in terms of its tourist attractions.

chinese: (also in respect of) (fml.) concerning or in relation to sth. 关于···；就···而言
examples: e.g. The two groups were similar with respect to income and status.

chinese: similar to, or at the same level as sth. 与···相似；与···水平一致
examples: e.g. The new policy is [[in line with]] the plans that were discussed last year.

chinese: (before common era) 公元前
中东（一般泛指欧、亚、非三洲连接的地区）
克鲁格（人名）
拜克（人名）
